result.execSummary:
The defendant Xavier Terrell Boone was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Identity Theft - Obtain Money or Credit, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.203(2)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $500.00 to Katrina H. To be paid first, before costs, fees, assessments and surcharges.

Pay the costs, fees, assessments and surcharges.   To be paid after restitution has been satisifed.  
AS TO RESTITUTION/ALL FINANCIAL OBLIGATIONS:  DOC to collect monetary sums/amounts at the rate of 25% of prison funds.  Balance during Extended supervision.  Failure to pay will result in civil judgment.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: No Contact Order with Katrina H.
AODA assessment. Comply with any recommended treatment.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis if not already done so.
Court advised defendant he cannot possess firearms, he must provide DNA sample; and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Xavier Terrell Boone

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original Transcript (38 pages) PLEA/SENTENCING HEARING commencing 01-12-2016 received and filed.

Sentencing proceeds.  State has complied with victim notification.  Statements by the State, defense counsel and defendant. 
COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms, he must provide a DNA sample and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  

As to Count 1:
COURT ORDERS defendant to serve a term in the Wisconsin State Prison system - TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE -  24  months, consecutive to any sentence, with Zero (0) days credit -  INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT -   12  months  -  EXTENDED SUPERVISION -   12  months

Court finds defendant   IS  eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program  and   IS  eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

-  Court sets Restitution in the amount of $500

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION: 
-  AODA assessment and comply with any recommended treatment
-  full time employment or a combination of part-time employment and school
-  No Contact Order with Katrina H.
-  Pay Restitution in the amount of $500 to Katrina H. during the term of extended supervision.  Restitution to be paid before the costs, fees, assessments and surcharges.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
-  Pay the costs, fees, assessments and surcharges during the term of extended supervision.  Costs, fees, assessments and surcharges to be paid after restitution has been satisfied.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

COURT ORDERS:
-  defendant to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis (if not already done so)
-  DOC to collect monetary sums/amounts at the rate of 25% of prison funds.

Appeal rights given.  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief and Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgment received and filed.  Copies given to the defendant.

Defendant Xavier Terrell Boone in court with Attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Defendant Xavier Terrell Boone in custody.  Joanne L Hardtke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

As to Count 1:
Defendant waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of GUILTY and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint and enters a judgment of conviction.

As to Count 2 and Count 3:
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court orders Count 2 and Count 3 DISMISSED, but read-in as to sentencing.

Parties are prepared to proceed to sentencing.

Clerk:  jms

Attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor in court, defendant Xavier Terrell Boone not in court, in custody.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court unable to proceed with plea/sentencing.  

Parties informed that effective December 14, 2015, this matter will be reassigned to Br. 28, Judge Sanders, Room 629 of the Courthouse.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 12, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor in court, defendant Xavier Terrell Boone not in court, in custody.  Francesco Mineo for Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Due to time constraints, matter adjourned.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 19, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Plea/Sentencing Hearing on Wednesday, November 18, 2015 at 1:30 PM in BR 21, CH 632 of the Circuit Court of Milwaukee County.

Attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor in court, defendant Xavier Terrell Boone not in court, in custody.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Due to time constraints, matter adjourned for plea/sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 18, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Xavier Terrell Boone in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Due to lateness of the hour, matter adjourned.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 26, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Due to court's congested calendar, an adjournment of the currently scheduled plea and sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 9, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Xavier Terrell Boone in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Defendant Xavier Terrell Boone in custody.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 1, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
NOTICE OF MOTION AND MOTION TO REDUCE BAIL.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Katrina H.; Mayfair Mall at 2500 N Mayfair Road, Wauwatosa; Walgreens at 10800 W Capital Drive, Wauwatosa and CVS at 7550 W Perkins Place, Wauwatosa

Defendant Xavier Terrell Boone in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Defendant Xavier Terrell Boone in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 10, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
